      • feedInputActivation

        public void feedInputActivation​(double[] input)
                         throws InvalidArgumentVectorSize
        Feeds the input values to the perceptrons in this layer.
        Parameters:
        input - vector of input values.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentVectorSize - on mismatch size of the parameter and layer nodes count.

      • calcLayerOutput

        public void calcLayerOutput()
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Invokes all the perceptrons in the layer and wait for their completion to gain the final output
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - on interruption of any running perceptron in the layer.

      • getLayerOutput

        public double[] getLayerOutput()
        Retrieves the activation i.e. output value of each node as a vector for this layer.
        Returns:
        vector of floating point values representing output values of each node of this layer.

      • allocNodes

        public void allocNodes​(int count)
        Parameters:
        count - number of nodes to allocate in this layer.

      • getNodesCount

        public int getNodesCount()
        Returns:
        the nodes

      • init_nodes

        public void init_nodes​(java.util.List<double[]> weights,
                       double[] activation,
                       double[] bias,
                       java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Double> transferFunction)
                throws InvalidArgumentVectorSize
        Parameters:
        weights - is List of double[] that takes weight vector for each node
        activation - is double vector to initialize activation value of each node
        bias - is double vector to initialize bias value of each node.
        transferFunction - is transfer Function definition for each node.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentVectorSize - If vector sizes do not matches with nodes count.
        InvalidArgumentVectorSize - if any of the argument vector size differs with the corresponding layer configuration.
